Directorate.LongName: Direct For Education and Human Resources

Award.AbstractNarration: The University of California - San Diego will hold the 2017 University of California Chemical Symposium for graduate students and postdoctoral scholars. The objectives are to provide the opportunity for early career scientists to present research, engage in social networking, improve communication and presentation skills for a general audience, explore future career path options, and develop mentorship and leadership skills. Participants will learn about the current state of chemical sciences within a range of disciplines and how to prepare for academic and nonacademic jobs. The symposium is expected to advance the array of chemical sciences and, at the same time, initiate collaborations and encourage discussions about future direction of these STEM fields.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The 2nd annual University of California Chemical Symposium (UCCS) is a UC-wide Chemistry and Biochemistry conference that was held on March 27-29, 2017 at the UCLA Lake Arrowhead Conference center. The conference was organized by a committee of 12 graduate students and postdoctoral researchers from across the University of California (UC) campuses and was attended by 99 graduate students and postdoctoral researchers with 92 presentations given.  Participating UC campuses included Berkeley, Davis, Los Angeles, Merced, Riverside, San Diego, San Francisco, Santa Cruz, and Santa Barbara.  Participants presented posters and talks on their research in the chemical sciences, with topics ranging from novel antibiotic development to nanotechnology.  In addition, career panel discussions were held with representatives from academic, government, and non-profit organizations to help provide career guidance to the young scientists in attendance.  Two established scientists, Prof. Vy Dong from U.C. Irvine and Prof. Catherine Murphy from the University of Illinois Urbana-Champange, gave inspiring plenary talks about their career paths and the latest, cutting edge research from their laboratories.  The best talks and poster presentations from students were awarded prizes sponsored by the American Chemical Society and the Royal Society of Chemistry (United Kingdom).  The conference was deemed a success and a new organizing committee is already at work planning for the 3rd annual UCCS in 2018.

 


Last Modified: 09/23/2017
Modified by: Seth M Cohen
